dmca.title: The Electric Slide...on stilts!
dmca.body:
I posted a video on YouTube. It was a clip of me appearing on the Today Show performing the Electric Slide...on stilts. A few weeks later I received the following notice from YouTube:

This is to notify you that we have removed or disabled access to the following material as a result of a third-party notification by http://the-electricslidedance.com claiming that this material is infringing:

Electric Slide on Stilts: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OFEw3NgMPwM

I thought the third party would come from NBC. But it did not. It was from [Sender], who claims to have invented the electric slide. Once again here is his website:

http://the-electricslidedance.com

Can he claim that me performing the electric slide on slilts is a copyright infringement? 

I can provide a video clip of my performance if needed.

Thanks!

[Recipient]
